desc: Article researching details about favicons/ favico' and their replacements.
title: Favicon notes

desc: This analysis aims to find out if Fontawesome, currently used, should be replaced. Research on 7 font tools: Fontawesome, Iconspedia, Fontisto, Fontello, Icons8, Phosphor, and MaterialUI.
title: Symbol Tools

desc: Investigation into making text more readable; what is a readable font for population segments that find reading more difficult.
title: Readable fonts

desc: Managed outcomes for fonts in a heterogeneous network.
title: Web Fonts 20

desc: A look at recent web fonts tech and the typographical options, and analysis of fonts readability.   A demo also is shown with font options achieving typographic effects inside CSS.
title: Web Fonts 24

desc: Maquette article, to play with options on utf-8 emoji.
title: Colouring your Emoticons/Emoji

desc: Notes on options for splitting CSS up away from minified monolith assets.
title: More media tricks for CSS

desc: What is the fastest way to put an image on screen?
title: Online Pictures

desc: SVG file format notes: its definition, structure, history; the colour spaces.  This is the initial article that covers how to make the file and the programs the files can be opened with. More advanced areas are discussed in separate articles.
title: SVG file format notes

desc: Description of animation options that SVG supports and how to create them. This includes 6 animation libraries along with 2 CSS animation techniques to animate SVG more easily
title: SVG animation

desc: A pulled out list of 16 SVG editors; ones that you install locally and online tools.  Updated 2023.
title: SVG Editors

desc: Details on how to make SVG files smaller, either with a tool, or what steps to take manually.
title: SVG Optimisation

desc: Modern CSS can automatically make columns, this will be much faster to run than JS adding and removing DOM nodes.
title: Columniser via CSS

desc: Text description for computers and how to generate them, also called caption and alt text depending on technique and audience.  These text descriptions are very useful for text to speech tools.
title: Image tooltips
